id.desc: Component ID, not specified by default. If specified, it can be used to refer the component in option or API.

zlevel.desc:
`zlevel` value of all graphical elements in .

`zlevel` is used to make layers with Canvas. Graphical elements with different `zlevel` values will be placed in different Canvases, which is a common optimization technique. We can put those frequently changed elements (like those with animations) to a separate `zlevel`. Notice that too many Canvases will increase memory cost, and should be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid crash.

Canvases with bigger `zlevel` will be placed on Canvases with smaller `zlevel`.

z.desc:
`z` value of all graphical elements in , which controls order of drawing graphical components. Components with smaller `z` values may be overwritten by those with larger `z` values.

`z` has a lower priority to `zlevel`, and will not create new Canvas.

left.desc:
Distance between calendar component and the left side of the container.

`left` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`; and it can also be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`.

If the `left` value is set to be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`, then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

top.desc:
Distance between calendar component and the top side of the container.

`top` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`; and it can also be `'top'`, `'middle'`, or `'bottom'`.

If the `left` value is set to be `'top'`, `'middle'`, or `'bottom'`, then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

right.desc:
Distance between calendar component and the right side of the container.

`right` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`.

Adaptive by default.

bottom.desc:
Distance between calendar component and the bottom side of the container.

`bottom` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`.

Adaptive by default.

orient.desc:
The layout orientation of calendar.

Options:
+ 'horizontal'
+ 'vertical'

splitLine.show.desc: Set this to `false` to prevent the splitLine from showing

splitLine.lineStyle.color.desc:
splitLineLine color.





> Supports setting as solid color using `rgb(255,255,255)`, `rgba(255,255,255,1)`, `#fff`, etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [option.color](~color) for details

splitLine.lineStyle.type.desc:
line type.


Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`dashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

type: [5, 10],

dashOffset: 5
}
```

splitLine.lineStyle.dashOffset.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`type`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

splitLine.lineStyle.cap.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

splitLine.lineStyle.join.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`miterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

splitLine.lineStyle.miterLimit.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`join`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

splitLine.lineStyle.shadowBlur.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

splitLine.lineStyle.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

splitLine.lineStyle.shadowOffsetX.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

splitLine.lineStyle.shadowOffsetY.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

itemStyle.desc: Every rect style in calendar coordinates.

itemStyle.color.desc:
calendar color.



> Supports setting as solid color using `rgb(255,255,255)`, `rgba(255,255,255,1)`, `#fff`, etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [option.color](~color) for details

itemStyle.borderColor.desc: calendar border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

itemStyle.borderWidth.desc:
calendar border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

(${name} ? ${name} : "") + " border width. No border when it is set to be 0."

itemStyle.borderType.desc:
calendar border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

borderType: [5, 10],

borderDashOffset: 5
}
```

itemStyle.borderDashOffset.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

itemStyle.borderCap.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

itemStyle.borderJoin.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`borderMiterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

itemStyle.borderMiterLimit.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`borderJoin`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

itemStyle.shadowBlur.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

itemStyle.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

itemStyle.shadowOffsetX.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

itemStyle.shadowOffsetY.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

dayLabel.show.desc: Set this to `false` to prevent dayLabel from showing.

dayLabel.margin.desc: The margin between the day label and the axis line.

dayLabel.position.desc:
Position of week, at the beginning or end of the range.

Options:
+ 'start'
+ 'end'

dayLabel.borderColor.desc: Border color of the text fragment.

dayLabel.borderWidth.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

dayLabel.borderType.desc:
the text fragment border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

borderType: [5, 10],

borderDashOffset: 5
}
```

dayLabel.borderDashOffset.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

dayLabel.borderRadius.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

dayLabel.padding.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

dayLabel.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color of the text block.

dayLabel.shadowBlur.desc: Show blur of the text block.

dayLabel.shadowOffsetX.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.

dayLabel.shadowOffsetY.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text block.

dayLabel.textBorderWidth.desc: Storke line width of the text.

dayLabel.textBorderType.desc:
Stroke line type of the text.


Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`textBorderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

textBorderType: [5, 10],

textBorderDashOffset: 5
}
```

dayLabel.textBorderDashOffset.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`textBorderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

dayLabel.textShadowColor.desc: Shadow color of the text itself.

dayLabel.textShadowBlur.desc: Shadow blue of the text itself.

dayLabel.textShadowOffsetX.desc: Shadow X offset of the text itself.

dayLabel.textShadowOffsetY.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

dayLabel.overflow.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow. Available when `width` is set.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the text and trailing with `ellipsis`.
+ `'break'` Break by word
+ `'breakAll'` Break by character.

dayLabel.ellipsis.desc: Ellipsis to be displayed when `overflow` is set to `truncate`.

dayLabel.lineOverflow.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow on height.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the overflow lines.

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.borderColor.desc: Border color of the text fragment.

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.borderWidth.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.borderType.desc:
the text fragment border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

borderType: [5, 10],

borderDashOffset: 5
}
```

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.borderDashOff.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.borderRadius.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.padding.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color of the text block.

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.shadowBlur.desc: Show blur of the text block.

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.shadowOffsetX.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.shadowOffsetY.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text block.

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.width.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.height.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.textBorderWid.desc: Storke line width of the text.

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.textBorderTyp.desc:
Stroke line type of the text.


Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`textBorderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

textBorderType: [5, 10],

textBorderDashOffset: 5
}
```

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.textBorderDas.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`textBorderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.textShadowCol.desc: Shadow color of the text itself.

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.textShadowBlu.desc: Shadow blue of the text itself.

dayLabel.rich.<style_name>.textShadowOff.desc: Shadow X offset of the text itself.
Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

yearLabel.margin.desc: The margin between the month label and the axis line.

yearLabel.position.desc:
Position of year.

Default:
when orient is set as `horizontal`, position is `left`
when orient is set as `vertical`, position is `top`

Options:
+ 'top'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'

yearLabel.borderWidth.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`textBorderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

textBorderType: [5, 10],

textBorderDashOffset: 5
}
```

yearLabel.textBorderDashOffset.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`textBorderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

yearLabel.textShadowColor.desc: Shadow color of the text itself.

yearLabel.textShadowBlur.desc: Shadow blue of the text itself.

yearLabel.textShadowOffsetX.desc: Shadow X offset of the text itself.

yearLabel.textShadowOffsetY.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

yearLabel.overflow.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow. Available when `width` is set.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the text and trailing with `ellipsis`.
+ `'break'` Break by word
+ `'breakAll'` Break by character.

yearLabel.ellipsis.desc: Ellipsis to be displayed when `overflow` is set to `truncate`.

yearLabel.lineOverflow.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow on height.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the overflow lines.

yearLabel.rich.<style_name>.borderColor.desc: Border color of the text fragment.

yearLabel.rich.<style_name>.borderWidth.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

yearLabel.rich.<style_name>.borderType.desc:
the text fragment border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

borderType: [5, 10],

borderDashOffset: 5
}
```

yearLabel.rich.<style_name>.borderDashOf.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

yearLabel.rich.<style_name>.borderRadius.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

yearLabel.rich.<style_name>.padding.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

yearLabel.rich.<style_name>.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color of the text block.

yearLabel.rich.<style_name>.shadowBlur.desc: Show blur of the text block.

yearLabel.rich.<style_name>.shadowOffset.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.
Shadow Y offset of the text block.

yearLabel.rich.<style_name>.width.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

yearLabel.rich.<style_name>.height.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

yearLabel.rich.<style_name>.textBorderWi.desc: Storke line width of the text.

yearLabel.rich.<style_name>.textBorderTy.desc:
Stroke line type of the text.


Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`textBorderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

textBorderType: [5, 10],

textBorderDashOffset: 5
}
```

yearLabel.rich.<style_name>.textBorderDa.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`textBorderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

yearLabel.rich.<style_name>.textShadowCo.desc: Shadow color of the text itself.

yearLabel.rich.<style_name>.textShadowBl.desc: Shadow blue of the text itself.

yearLabel.rich.<style_name>.textShadowOf.desc: Shadow X offset of the text itself.
Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

silent.desc: Whether to ignore mouse events. Default value is false, for triggering and responding to mouse events.
